Lesion.definition: loss from failure to receive a threshold amount or value
Lesion.origin: [Anglo-French, damage, injury, from Latin laesio , from laedere to injure]

1.1: loss from failure to receive a threshold amount or value (as one-half market value) for immovable property conveyed or transferred by a commutative contract (as a sale or exchange) [a new partition may be demanded for the least "
